page.title: 11EBURNE SCHOOL WORK 2
page.content: Children who live in the square studied attend one of the four schools built in the area. Since they are not expected to attend for 24 hours a day and seven days a week many children fill their day with many other activities. Watching video films at home, riding BMX bikes and playing at nearby parks are very popular. Some children prefer to play at home with dolls and prams. A few have a swing in their back gardens. Some children attend Cubs and Brownies at St Chads Church. Older members of the Community enjoy the Pensioners Club at Wood End Community Centre and a few have a meal at Eburne school where Junior children are the servers. Many other adults are active in the Wood End Tenants Association who aim to improve the area's image.
